alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 4:18PM MST until September 10 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... eastern Coconino County in north central Arizona... southern Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST /830 PM MDT/. * At 417 PM MST /517 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Winslow to Holbrook. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winslow, Holbrook, Joseph City, Sun Valley and Homolovi State Park Campground. This includes the following swimming holes... Clear Creek Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 249 and 298. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 252 and 289. State Route 377 between mile markers 20 and 33. State Route 77 between mile markers 379 and 408. State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 42. State Route 87 between mile markers 333 and 360. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 315. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pueblo Colorado Wash, Digger Wash, Humpy Wash, Clear Creek, Manila Wash, Chevelon Canyon, Potato Wash, Blairs Spring Wash, Cottonwood Wash, East Twin Wash, Fivemile Wash, East Washboard Wash, Mesa Wash, Billy Wash, West Twin Wash, Tucker Flat Wash, Puerco River, Fern Feather Wash, Jacks Canyon, Washboard Wash, Little Colorado River, Black Canyon, Joseph City Wash, Porter Tank Draw, McDonald Canyon, Tanner Wash, Carr Lake Draw and Leroux Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
